string.text: What can I expect for matches in the future?
Well you're now qualified to have more free reign over how the battles function here at the Arena, now that you've progressed through the ranks.

Well it'll play out as follows. Starting in approximately 24 hours, we'll be prepared to host a restructured Arena, now that we've acquired enough officials to moderate it. You being one of them, if you choose to that is.

 You'll arrange matches that you may or may not participate in yourself, place wagers, and watch as the chaos unfolds.

 However, we have to organize the matches, so they'll be held at a specific time, however you'll be notified via radio broadcast when these events are going to occur.
Are there any events taking place currently?
As I've stated before, you'll have to wait for the designated time. You'll be notified via broadcast.
Thanks, we'll see how I fair next time around.
Your victory will not be counted.
You'll be fined for violating the rules of the match.
Hello there Marked One! Glad to see you're back. \n\n Why don't we put on a show today? Do you think you're prepared to battle a couple of Mutants?
Marked One, listen. You've got a problem. Warring factions have decided to unite against a common enemy.
And how is that a problem?
The problem is that the enemy I'm referring to...is you. Remember how many people you've sent to the other side? Well, the guys who are still left are refusing to fight you...alone.

Hey there, Marked One. We've been getting full on mutants lately, we're almost running out of room in the pens. And as if on purpose, nobody wants to fight them. Maybe you could free up some space for us?
Just think about it. The work's good. You'll help us, entertain the spectators, and you'll earn some cash at the same time.
Great, Marked One. The Arena's open again, so quickly pick a match. Our schedule's quite full today.
Could you include me in your notification list again?
Could you please stop sending me those messages?
No doubt about it. Deleting your PDA from the contact list.
Could you possibly turn on a few more lights in the arena?
I'll see what I can do.
Please turn the lights back the way they were.
Turn them on, turn them off. Make up your damn mind already, heh.
Well, what kind of fights you got today?
None right now, wait until we open.
That's all for today. No more people want to fight today.

If you're absolutely sure of your abilities, might I suggest a timed match? These battles usually don't last long and demand some mastery in the art of death.

 There's a possibility of getting bonuses or even doubling your winnings if you win within the smallest amount of time. Remember one iron rule, you CANNOT kill your opponent after the timer runs out. If you do, you'll be fined the same amount as the winnings.

 I think you'll agree, it's better to stay with your own ass intact and with no prize than having to pay what you were supposed to win. And I need as many living contestants for other matches, too, so you'll help me by following that rule.

 Well, what do you say? Should I turn on that stopwatch?
Who are you placing your bets on?
Maybe another time, my pockets are empty.
Eh, I don't care for that guy.
All bets have been registered. No more will be accepted.

Well here's how it works. You'll choose the contestants for battle, and subsequently place wagers on one of the respective sides of the battle.\n\n If your wager is correct, then you can expect a refund with some extra stacked on top, and if you lose, then at least you got to watch an intense match.
Finally, Duty's started delivering live mutants to the arena again. Even some rare ones too.\n\n Choose your next victim?

I'm honestly surprised that they've managed to secure Military Soldiers as contestants for The Arena, however I don't make a point of asking too many questions.\n\n There aren't many doubts as to the professionalism of these soldiers. They all have alot of experience behind their shoulders to my knowledge at least. Some of these guys have been around during Afghanistan, Georgia, and Chechnya, and they've even spent a few years in the Zone, so they're still sharp. They're armed with the best guns their Russian government can produce.

Mercenaries are a very organized paramilitary group made up of many different private contractors. They carry imported guns, so they're not short on cash. Rumor says that they work for foreign interests and governments, in addition to Russian, Ukrainian, and possibly even Georgian clients.\n\n I'd call them a side-effect of Ukraine's government trying so hard to join NATO. Many locals try to keep as far away from them as they can, but to the military, they are like a sharp bone in their throats. They give the mercs the highest priority if they spot them, which kind of makes me respect the soldiers. The firepower of the mercs is hard to ignore, which is why some groupings even have contacts among them.

Freedomers are the arch enemies of Duty. They have alot of former Dutyers among their ranks, ones that rejected the "we are the last hope of humanity" ideology of that faction. That's one of the reasons why relations between the two factions are very tense, to put it softly. Even though Duty considers Freedom to be nothing more than a gaggle of stoned anarchists, Freedom still put up a hard fight.\n\n Freedom is definately more organized than that, and their guns and armor aren't that bad, either. Duty had many of their best fighters cross over, so their experience in battle is something to be respected. At the moment, there's a cease-fire between the two factions, but it's pretty shaky.

The Duty faction is our self-declared police force. It's thanks to them that we have fights to the death in our humble arena, in addition to them capturing mutants for me. Members of this faction regularly participate in arena matches to sharpen their skills and practice for future raids into the deepest reaches of the Zone. They are armed with the same gear as our government's Spetsnaz, with the best Warsaw Pact firearms available.

The usual loners, ones that either stay away from or have yet to join any faction. You might see some familiar faces among them, even recognize the guy you shared a bottle with a few weeks ago. It's a good way to make some enemies or thin out your competition for artifacts. They're armed with a myriad of guns. Warsaw Pact guns, imported rifles, you name it, but I've yet to see them armed with anything that makes me jealous.

The usual party of Death-Row prisoners captured in the Dark Valley. They've been given rented guns, arena weapons, so don't think for one moment that they'll be shooting at you from rusted double-barrels and Makarovs they took from dead cops they killed back in '75.
Every faction is represented in this team. The number of opponents is slightly higher than usual, and all of them are dead-set on making you pay for all of their comrades that you killed.
You don't have that many chances of coming back. Are you sure you want to accept their challenge?
I've been through worse. Announce the match.
Here Stalkers from different factions kill off two mutants, or vice-versa, depends on how lucky they are. Which battle will we watch today?

This is a tournament between factions. Each one tries to prove that they're better than the other. Small conflicts and disagreements between them are also solved here with minimal casualties. The rules are simple: there are a few teams, they kill each other until only one, the strongest, is left standing. Shall we begin?
The arena will now close for cleaning and maintenance. No more matches today.
The time for matches is over. Whoever didn't make it on time, too bad.
The Arena is now open, please make your way to the stadium outside of the bar if you're interested.
Anyone willing to participate in a match in the arena: come to the bar area immediately. First match begins in three hours.
Six hours left until the Arena opens.
Twelve hours left until the Arena opens.
A reminder to everyone: matches will resume in the Arena in exactly 24 hours.
The Arena will open in 48 hours, volunteers for matches are still being accepted.
Approximate time until the Arena's next opening is three days.
I'm afraid Arnie has been killed. The Arena is now closed for an undecided period of time, pay attention to the announcements.
We are pleased to announce that we have found a new Arena administrator. The Arena is open once again.
What the hell is this?! Some asshole killed the Arena administrator again! Can someone please stop this crazed animal already?
Listen up, you bastard! If I find out what your name is, you're better off shooting yourself! Don't wait until my guys find your sorry ass, they'll cut you for a long, long time.
All Stalkers in the bar! The Arena owner has been killed. Find the killer, it's about damn time we stop this shit once and for all.

Fellas, the guy in charge of the Arena has been killed once again. The killer is still nearby. Find him, but don't kill him. Just shoot his kneecaps out and throw him in a fire. Duty will then hang the remains of this piece of excrement by the main gate.

There's a little problem...Arnie somehow got himself into an anomaly while drunk. In short, he got ripped up, not even any bones left. So, you all probably understand, fellas, that there will be no more fights at the Arena until we find a new administrator. When we do, I'll let you know.

Goddammit, the new Arena administrator has disappeared. If someone manages to catch the scent of alcohol that he probably reeks of right now, and finds that drunk son of a bitch, immediately drag him back to the bar. I'll pay you, but I doubt you'll find him anyway. The Arena will be closed until we either find the administrator or someone to replace him.
I went to the bar to drink vodka. No loitering until I'm back.
I went to the bar to drink all your money...losers.
If someone needs me, search for me at the bar. I'll warn you now, though. There won't be any conversation unless you've got a bottle with you.
Man, day after day it's all the same...just vodka, vodka, vodka. Anyway, I'm off to the bar.
